cards.front: What are Newton's three laws of motion?
cards.back: 1) An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force. 2) The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass. 3) For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

questions.stem: What is the third law of motion, also known as the action-reaction principle, stated as?
options: Every action creates an equal and opposite reaction
The acceleration of an object is proportional to the net force acting upon it
An object in motion will stay in motion unless acted upon by another force
The work done by a constant force on an object is equal to the product of the force and the distance moved by the object
questions.rationale: It explains the action-reaction principle, stating that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction

insights.title: Newton's Laws of Motion Insight
insights.takeaway: Newton's first law (Law of Inertia) states that an object at rest will stay at rest, and an object in motion will stay in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force. Newton's second law (F = ma) describes the relationship between an object's acceleration, its mass, and the net force acting upon it. Newton's third law states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

cards.back: A subset of artificial intelligence that provides systems the ability to automatically learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed.

cards.front: What are the main types of Machine Learning?
cards.back: Supervised learning (learns from labeled data), unsupervised learning (learns from unlabeled data), and reinforcement learning (learns through rewards and penalties).
